context: 45 46 Activated T-cells in vascular plaques release interferon-γ, which in turn stimulates the production and release of neopterin from macrophages. 16 The biological effects of neopterin include activation of both constitutive and inducible nitric oxide synthase with ensuing alterations in the intracellular redox state. 47 48 As a result, neopterin facilitates the translocation of nuclear factor-κB, 49 50 which then promotes the expression of adhesion molecules, tissue factor, 51 and a number of proinflammatory factors including interleukin-6 and tumor necrosis factor-α. 52 Thus, neopterin not only carries prognostic value, it may also directly contribute to the pathogenesis of atherosclerosis by augmenting the inflammatory response. Although inferences regarding cause and effect between SDB and elevated neopterin levels are not possible based on the current investigation, there is good biological basis to speculate that SDB-related hypoxia may be one of the putative factors. Empirical data supporting that notion come from experiments that reveal hypoxia-mediated alterations in innate immunity. Healthy subjects exposed to hypobaric hypoxia for as little as 20 min show an increase in the concentration and functional activity of circulating leukocytes and lymphocytes.
